intro: Acinodendron macranthum, commonly known as the large-flowered acinodendron, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Acinodendron macranthum is typically found in moist, shaded habitats within forest understories.
